D, a compile error occurs.

if we change "Stream<String> nInSt = iStr.flatMapToInt((x) -> x.stream ());"
to "Stream<String> nInSt = iStr.flatMap((x) -> x.stream ());"
then the output is 1John2null
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
D is correct since x.stream() return Stream of String and not int.

Compilation error: incompatible types: bad return type in lambda expression
 Stream<String> nInSt = iStr.flatMapToInt((x) -> x.stream());
 ^
 Stream<String> cannot be converted to IntStream
The correct answer is D.

questions.question_text:
Given:
//IMG//
and the command: java Product 0
What is the result?

discussion.content: Answer C because the command haven´t -ea

Selected Answer: C
C is correct since program isnt run with -ea or -enableassertions and assert statement is skipped.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct because we don't enable assert
the assert keyword is disabled by default. To enable the assert you need to provide the "-ea" option when running java command. In this case the assert line wouldn't be evaluated. Answer is C
Answer is A. assert runs where the result is false. When it is true, it will continue from the next line.
